alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 16 at 5:13AM AKST until February 16 at 5:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow, freezing rain, and rain expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Matanuska Valley. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 5 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will overspread the Matanuska Valley beginning early this morning. The snow may be heavy at times, especially around the morning commute. A transition to a rain/snow mix is possible for areas east of Wasilla as warmer air moves through the Knik River Valley toward Palmer through this morning. Any mixed precipitation is expected to transition back to all snow by late this afternoon before slowly tapering off through the evening. The timing of the transition remains uncertain and snow totals will be lower should a transition to rain or mixed precipitation occur earlier in the morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
